faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can freely purchase property in Spain with very few restrictions. Most nationalities can acquire residential or investment property without special permits. Some EU regulations may apply depending on your country of origin, but generally, the process is straightforward with professional legal assistance.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 6-8% in additional costs. This includes transfer tax (3% in Alicante region), notary fees (1%), registration fees (0.5%), and legal fees (1-2%). Plus, annual property tax (IBI) is typically 0.4-0.9% of cadastral value. Professional guidance ensures all costs are transparent and optimised.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles—IBI) ranges from 0.4% to 0.9% of cadastral value yearly. This is significantly lower than UK council tax equivalents. Plus, if renting the property, rental income is taxed at your marginal rate. Professional tax advice optimises your tax position as a foreign property owner.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish and international banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typically, foreign borrowers can secure 70-80% loan-to-value financing. Requirements include valid NIE (Spanish tax number), proof of income, and credit checks. Interest rates are competitive, often lower than UK equivalents. Professional mortgage advisors guide you through the process.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value with costs 20-30% lower than northern Europe. Groceries, dining, and utilities are particularly affordable. Healthcare and education are high-quality yet reasonably priced. A comfortable lifestyle costs significantly less than UK equivalents, making it attractive for retirees and remote workers.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ sunshine days annually. Summers are warm (28-30°C), winters mild (10-15°C). Rainfall is minimal and concentrated in autumn/spring. The climate is perfect for beach activities, outdoor dining, and year-round relaxation—ideal for holiday home owners seeking consistent sunshine.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from a holiday property in Benissa?
faqs.answer: Holiday rentals in Benissa typically generate €800+ per week, translating to €40,000+ annually depending on occupancy rates. With 70-80% occupancy (typical for established coastal areas), you could achieve €28,000-€32,000 annual rental income. Professional property management services handle bookings and maintenance, maximising returns.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is 1,000 miles from the UK, approximately 2.5 hours flight time from London, Manchester, and other major British airports. Budget airlines offer frequent daily connections, making it convenient for holiday home owners who visit regularly. The accessibility makes it perfect for maintaining connections with family and friends back home.
